| A thug:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [monst.c#line3172](/wiki/Monst.c#line3172 "Monst.c") |

The **thug**, @, is a [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). Thugs are chaotic like player and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)"), and they also [like gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover"), though you will not usually see this behavior unless you anger one.

## Encyclopedia entry

A worshipper of Kali, who practised \_thuggee\_, the strangling of human victims in the name of the religion. Robbery of the victim provided the means of livelihood. They were also called \_Phansigars\_ (Noose operators) from the method employed.  
Vigorous suppression was begun by Lord William Bentinck in 1828, but the fraternity did not become completely extinct for another 50 years or so.  
In common parlance the word is used for any violent "tough".

\[ Brewer's Concise Dictionary of Phrase and Fable ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")

Thug

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ thug
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6
@ thug
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6

Base level 5
Base experience 66
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A thug:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3172

The thug, @, is a Rogue quest guardian. Thugs are chaotic like player and player monster rogues, and they also like gold, though you will not usually see this behavior unless you anger one.

Encyclopedia entry

A worshipper of Kali, who practised _thuggee_, the strangling of human victims in the name of the religion. Robbery of the victim provided the means of livelihood. They were also called _Phansigars_ (Noose operators) from the method employed.
Vigorous suppression was begun by Lord William Bentinck in 1828, but the fraternity did not become completely extinct for another 50 years or so.
In common parlance the word is used for any violent "tough".

[ Brewer's Concise Dictionary of Phrase and Fable ]
